snippet: The close American ally has turned a cold shoulder after revelations of espionage, even as both sides acknowledge the urgency of cooperation on global issues.
abstract: Germany, once America's closest European ally, has turned a cold shoulder after revelations of espionage, even as both sides acknowledge the urgency of cooperation on global issues; recent reports of American spying in Germany have caused severe new tensions.

byline.contributor: Mark Mazzetti contributed reporting from Washington, and Victor Homola from Berlin.

lead_paragraph: The close American ally has turned a cold shoulder after revelations of espionage, even as both sides acknowledge the urgency of cooperation on global issues.

headline.main: Behind German Spy Cases, Twists Worthy of Films
